title: For Trump, Flashy Summits Come First. Grunt Work Comes Next.
summary: Diplomats scrambled to come up with detailed proposals for security guarantees and other sticking points following two high-level summits in Alaska and Washington.

title: How Zelensky Made Progress With Trump
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine had a remarkably different White House visit on Monday than the ambush he walked into six months ago. Michael Schwirtz, the global intelligence correspondent for The New York Times, explains how President Zelensky courted President Trump and managed to put the ball back in Vladimir V. Putin’s court.

title: How Europe Learned to Speak So Trump Would Listen
summary: The leaders of Germany, France, Britain and other supporters of Ukraine have come together in exceptional ways to help sway the U.S. president.

title: Will Putin Meet With Zelensky to End the Ukraine War?
summary: The Kremlin is keeping its options open, but analysts said the Russian leader would probably only meet with his Ukrainian counterpart to accept a capitulation.

title: Trump Says He’s Ended 6 (or 7) Wars. Here’s Some Context.
summary: President Trump has cast himself as a global peacemaker. His interventions have calmed some conflicts, while in others his role is less clear.

title: Trump Wants Universities to Show Him the Money, or No Deal
summary: President Trump has personally stipulated that hefty financial penalties be part of agreements his administration is negotiating with the elite universities. Critics call it extortion.

title: Documents Add Detail to Fox Hosts’ Desire to Help Trump
summary: The documents were released as part of a defamation case against Fox Corporation filed by Smartmatic, an election technology company.

title: Trump Revokes Security Clearances of 37 Former and Current Officials
summary: The move is the latest effort by the Trump administration to shift the public’s attention to the 2016 election.

title: Trump Says Smithsonian Focuses Too Much on ‘How Bad Slavery Was’
summary: The remark, made as the president has ordered a wide-ranging review of museum exhibits, added to his pattern of minimizing Black history.

title: ICE Wrongly Suggests Lawmaker Doxxed Agents, and Racist Threats Follow
summary: A state representative in Connecticut had posted on Instagram about immigration enforcement efforts in his district but did not give detailed information.

title: Abrego Garcia’s Lawyers Accuse Trump Administration of Vindictive Prosecution
summary: It was the second time that Mr. Abrego Garcia’s lawyers have sought to hold the Trump administration accountable over its handling of his expulsion to El Salvador and its aftermath.

title: Adams Asks Trump Administration to Stop Courthouse Migrant Detentions
summary: Federal prosecutors dropped charges against Mayor Eric Adams of New York so that he could help with deportations. But the administration and the city have been jousting in court.

title: National Guard Troops in Washington Stick to Tourist Areas
summary: The number of troops in the city is expected to grow. But Army officials appear to be trying to keep them on the sidelines of President Trump’s mission.

title: Pirro Orders Office to Maximize Criminal Charges on Street Arrests
summary: The instruction amounts to a declaration that the understaffed U.S. attorney’s office will seek to ramp up criminal charges arising from the president’s takeover of law enforcement in the capital.

title: In Battle Over D.C. Police, Federal Prosecutors Open Inquiry Into Crime Data
summary: The same U.S. attorney’s office that praised a drop in crime in the capital in April has begun an investigation into the Police Department resisting President Trump’s takeover.

title: Arkansas Housing Development Restricted to White Residents Sparks Legal Concerns
summary: Housing rights experts say a community restricted to white residents is illegal, but the creators believe they could win a potential challenge in court in the current political climate.

title: At Hamptons Fund-Raiser, Cuomo Predicts Help From Trump Is on the Way
summary: Andrew M. Cuomo, who trails in the polls for New York City mayor, is said to have told a crowd of donors that he believed President Trump would help smooth his path to victory.

title: How Keen Footwear Stays Ahead of Trump’s Shifting Tariffs
summary: Keen Footwear has limited its exposure to supply chain trouble and opened a plant in Kentucky. But the trade upheaval has strained its adaptive strategy.

title: The Rainforests Being Cleared to Build Your R.V.
summary: American demand for tropical wood that is used in motor homes, conservationists say, is accelerating the disappearance of some of the world’s largest forests.

title: No Tariff Exemption for European Wine and Spirits, at Least for Now
summary: As the text of a trade agreement comes together, European Union negotiators haven’t persuaded the Americans to cut alcohol tariffs to zero.

title: Why Does Xi Keep Purging Loyalists? Look to Stalin and Mao for the Answer.
summary: China’s “bedside eavesdroppers,” the online posse parsing rumors for power shifts, have a lot to work with as Xi Jinping pushes aside his own political appointees.

title: Hong Kong Government Fixates on ‘Soft Resistance’
summary: With pro-democracy movements long squashed, the government is targeting any hint of subtler expressions of discontent. Even establishment figures say it may be too much.

title: Texas Rep. Nicole Collier Slept on the House Floor in Protest
summary: Nicole Collier, a state representative, slept in the Capitol rather than agree to police surveillance imposed by Republicans after a Democratic walkout. “I am resisting,” she said.

title: California Republicans File Suit Seeking to Block Newsom Redistricting Plan
summary: Republican state lawmakers argue that Democratic lawmakers violated 30-day disclosure rules in the California Constitution.

title: Hurricane Erin Brings Rip Currents Closing NYC and NJ Beaches
summary: Beaches along the New Jersey coast and in Delaware were closed Tuesday as the powerful storm churned in the Atlantic. New York City announced its beaches would close on Wednesday and Thursday.

title: North Carolina Beach Towns Brace for Dangerous Seas From Hurricane Erin
summary: Most of the tourists have left Ocracoke Island, and the surfers are watching closely as deadly rip currents lurk below the waves.

title: Talking Past Each Other in Israel
summary: We must find a way to speak in a common language again, a language that has a name for everything, even for a person holding a photograph of a dead child.

title: Ukraine Diplomacy Reveals How Un-American Trump Is
summary: Trump doesn’t feel any gut need to bring Ukraine into the West or understand that Putin’s invasion of that country was just his latest march to break up the West.

title: Israel Says It Killed a Hamas Militant Involved in Yarden Bibas Kidnapping
summary: Mr. Bibas, his wife and their two small children were abducted and taken to Gaza. Only he survived.

title: Once a Source of Life and Renewal, Monsoon Brings Death to Pakistan
summary: With villages swept away and Pakistan’s largest city assailed by monsoon floods, climate change has brought a catastrophic new normal to the country.

title: Susan Collins to Get Hollywood Treatment at Fund-Raiser Featuring Democrats
summary: Democrats hoping to retake the Senate in the midterm elections next year are targeting the seat of Senator Collins, a Maine Republican who is seen as a moderate.

title: Stabbing at Arizona High School Leaves 1 Student Dead, Officials Say
summary: A fight between two students at Maryvale High School in Phoenix on Tuesday left one fatally stabbed and the other with non-life-threatening injuries and in custody, officials said.
